episodeTitle: The Warrior Known as the Devil!! The Moment of Oars' Revival!
description: Brook parts ways with Franky and Robin to reclaim his shadow from Ryuma. Meanwhile, Moria reveals his ultimate zombie weapon - the massive ancient giant Oars - and resurrects him using Luffy's stolen shadow, creating a terrifying new threat for the Straw Hats.

events.title: Brook Reveals Zombie Weakness - Salt
events.description: Brook explains to Franky and Robin that salt can be used to purify zombies and expel shadows from their bodies. He reveals that shadows are taken via Devil Fruit powers, and since Devil Fruit users are weakened by seawater, ordinary salt destroys zombies.
events.significance: Reveals a crucial weakness of Moria's zombie army that will be exploited by the Straw Hats in future battles. This is critical tactical information for defeating the zombies on Thriller Bark.

quotes.text: Even without the shadow, the body still lives. Shadows are taken via Devil Fruit powers, and Devil Fruit users are weakened by seawater - that's why ordinary salt destroys zombies.
quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook explaining zombie weaknesses to his allies

events.title: Brook Departs to Confront Ryuma
events.description: Brook parts ways with Franky and Robin, declaring he will no longer run away and must defeat the zombie Ryuma to reclaim his shadow. He gives them salt for fighting zombies and warns them to protect the unconscious crew members on the Thousand Sunny.
events.significance: Demonstrates Brook's character development and determination to fulfill his promise. Sets up his eventual confrontation with Ryuma for the return of his shadow.

quotes.text: I won't run any longer. I must defeat the zombie who holds possession of my shadow - Ryuma.
quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook's declaration before leaving to fight Ryuma

events.title: Oars the Continent-Puller Revealed
events.description: Moria leads his subordinates into a massive freezer where he unveils his ultimate zombie weapon - the corpse of Oars, an ancient giant standing 67 meters tall. Moria explains that Oars was known as the 'Continent-Puller' and established a criminal nation over 500 years ago.
events.significance: Introduces Oars, one of the major antagonists of the Thriller Bark arc. The reveal of this massive zombie establishes the scale of threat the Straw Hats will face and demonstrates Moria's ambitions.

quotes.text: This is the great conqueror known as Oars - the Continent-Puller who built a nation of criminals 500 years ago!
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria
quotes.context: Moria introducing Oars to his subordinates

events.title: Hogback's Decade-Long Restoration of Oars
events.description: Hogback reveals that he has been working on restoring and preserving Oars' corpse for the past 10 years since he first met Moria. The ancient giant's body has been meticulously prepared for resurrection.
events.significance: Shows the long-term planning and preparation that went into Moria's ultimate zombie project, highlighting the importance Moria places on this creation.

quotes.text: I've been working on restoring and preserving Oars' corpse since I met you 10 years ago.
quotes.speaker: Hogback
quotes.context: Explaining the preparation for Oars' resurrection

events.title: Moria Reveals Kaido Defeated Him in the New World
events.description: Gecko Moria mentions that he would not have lost to Kaido in the New World if he had possessed a powerful enough zombie. This reveals that Moria was defeated by one of the Four Emperors, which destroyed his original crew and dreams.
events.significance: First significant mention of Kaido in the series, one of the Four Emperors. Explains Moria's motivation for creating a zombie army and his desire for revenge. This foreshadows Kaido's importance as a major antagonist later in the series.

quotes.text: I would not have lost to Kaido in the New World if I had a strong enough zombie. I'll become King of the Pirates with my zombie army and get my revenge on Kaido!
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria
quotes.context: Moria revealing his past defeat and future ambitions

events.title: Dreams of the Thriller Bark Pirates
events.description: Moria, Absalom, and Perona discuss their individual dreams now that Oars is about to be resurrected. Absalom wants to become 'King of the Graves,' Perona wants to be queen of all cute animal zombies, and Moria aims to become Pirate King with his zombie army.
events.significance: Reveals the personal motivations of the Thriller Bark Pirates' leadership and shows how they all benefit from Moria's zombie army plan.

events.title: Oars Resurrected with Luffy's Shadow
events.description: Moria uses his Kage Kage no Mi power to implant Luffy's stolen shadow into the corpse of Oars. After moments of anticipation, the massive 67-meter ancient giant zombie comes to life, opening his eyes and beginning to move.
events.significance: Creates the primary antagonist threat for the climax of the Thriller Bark arc. Combining Luffy's personality and abilities with Oars' immense size and strength makes this the most dangerous zombie Moria has created.

events.title: Oars Awakens with Luffy's Personality
events.description: Immediately upon awakening, Oars displays Luffy's personality traits by shouting 'MEAT!' and demanding food. His behavior mirrors Luffy's carefree and food-obsessed nature despite being in a giant zombie body.
events.significance: Demonstrates that shadows carry the personality and memories of their original owners. This creates both comedic moments and foreshadows the challenge of controlling this zombie despite its power.

events.title: Nami, Usopp, and Chopper Witness Oars' Revival
events.description: Hidden in the freezer, Nami, Usopp, and Chopper witness the resurrection of Oars in horror. They realize the terrifying threat this massive zombie poses to the crew, especially since it contains Luffy's shadow and abilities.
events.significance: Establishes the Straw Hats' awareness of the Oars threat and sets up their need to warn the rest of the crew about this new danger.

events.title: Straw Hats Escape During Oars' Rampage
events.description: As Oars begins to rampage through the freezer demanding food, Nami, Usopp, and Chopper use the chaos to escape. Moria's group is too distracted by the newly awakened giant to notice the three Straw Hats fleeing.
events.significance: Demonstrates Oars' uncontrollable nature even from the moment of awakening, creating problems for Moria's crew and allowing the Straw Hats to escape with vital intelligence.

quotes.text: Even without the shadow, the body still lives. Shadows are taken via Devil Fruit powers, and Devil Fruit users are weakened by seawater - that's why ordinary salt destroys zombies.
quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Explaining zombie weaknesses to Franky and Robin

quotes.text: I won't run any longer. I must defeat the zombie who holds possession of my shadow - Ryuma.
quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook's declaration before leaving to confront Ryuma

quotes.text: This is the great conqueror known as Oars - the Continent-Puller who built a nation of criminals 500 years ago!
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria

quotes.text: I would not have lost to Kaido in the New World if I had a strong enough zombie. I'll become King of the Pirates with my zombie army and get my revenge on Kaido!
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria
quotes.context: Revealing his past defeat and motivation for creating zombie army

quotes.speaker: Oars (with Luffy's shadow)
quotes.context: Oars' first words upon awakening, displaying Luffy's personality

themes.description: Moria's creation of Oars is driven by his desire for revenge against Kaido, who destroyed his original crew in the New World. His ambition to become Pirate King through an undead army shows his twisted approach to achieving power.
themes.symbolism: Oars represents Moria's attempt to overcome his past failures through artificial strength rather than genuine bonds with living crew members.

themes.description: Brook's decision to stop running and confront Ryuma demonstrates his growth and commitment to reclaiming what was stolen from him. His willingness to face a stronger opponent shows the courage needed to achieve his dreams.
themes.symbolism: Brook's journey to reclaim his shadow mirrors the series' theme of fighting for one's identity and dreams despite overwhelming odds.

themes.description: The episode explores how Moria seeks power through zombies rather than living allies, contrasting with Luffy's approach of building genuine friendships. This highlights different philosophies about what makes a strong pirate crew.
themes.symbolism: The resurrection of Oars with Luffy's shadow creates a dark mirror of Luffy himself - all the power but without the heart and humanity that makes Luffy truly strong.

characterSpotlights.development: Brook demonstrates character growth by choosing to face his fears and confront Ryuma rather than continuing to run. He also shows tactical intelligence by sharing the zombie weakness with his allies.
keyActions: Reveals salt as zombie weakness to Franky and Robin
Gives allies salt for fighting zombies
Declares he will confront Ryuma to reclaim his shadow
Parts ways with Franky and Robin to pursue his goal
quotes: I won't run any longer. I must defeat the zombie who holds possession of my shadow - Ryuma.

characterSpotlights.role: Primary antagonist revealing his ultimate weapon
characterSpotlights.development: Moria's backstory is revealed, showing his defeat by Kaido and motivation for creating a zombie army. His ambitions and methods are fully displayed as he resurrects Oars.
keyActions: Leads subordinates to the freezer containing Oars
Reveals his past defeat by Kaido in the New World
Uses Kage Kage no Mi to implant Luffy's shadow into Oars
Successfully resurrects the ancient giant zombie
quotes: I would not have lost to Kaido in the New World if I had a strong enough zombie. I'll become King of the Pirates with my zombie army and get my revenge on Kaido!

characterSpotlights.development: Oars is introduced as an ancient legendary giant and brought to life with Luffy's shadow, establishing him as a primary threat for the arc's climax.
keyActions: Is revealed as Moria's ultimate zombie weapon
Awakens and immediately displays Luffy's personality

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended some scenes showing the Straw Hats' reactions to Oars and added more comedic moments with Oars demanding food.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first significant mention of Kaido, one of the Four Emperors, who would later become a major antagonist in the Wano Country arc.
Oars stands at 67 meters (219'10') tall and weighs 102 tons, making him one of the largest characters introduced in the series at this point.
Hogback worked on preserving Oars' corpse for 10 years before this episode, showing the long-term planning involved in Moria's scheme.
The opening theme 'Jungle P' by 5050 was the first One Piece opening to feature both Franky and the Thousand Sunny as part of the Straw Hat crew.
